å°±æ¸¸æˆæœ¬èº«è€Œè¨€  å’Œåˆšå¼€å§‹æ¯”   uiæœ‰äº†è¾ƒå¤§çš„æ”¹è¿›  å¤šäº†ä¸ªèµ›åæ•°æ®  åªç©äº†ä¸¤æŠŠ   å°±è¿™æ ·
Do your part, get this to be the lowest reviewed game on steam, get blizzard to fucking notice
Find something better to do, go jxxk off or do some homework.

If your main selling point of Overwatch 2 was a PvE mode with a lot of progression, but you end up canceling it just to add a lesser version of said PvE mode, that is locked behind a paywall, you deserve all the negative reviews you can get, even if that means that Blizzard is not likely to put their other games, like World of Warcraft, the Starcraft franchise and Heathrstone, on Steam which would be a shame.

But, I'm glad that I don't have to launch battlenet when I play Overwatch 2 via Steam - EA & Ubisoft could learn something from that!

Speaking of Ubisoft learning from another company, Blizzard managed to add Steam achievements to their game - something that Ubisoft is too stupid to manage after slowly putting their games back on Steam.

Porn carried Overwatch 1 when the content dried up and porn is going to carry Overwatch 2 as well because the artists care more about the game than the actual devs (except for the art-team, they rock). Overwatch 2 looks better than Overwatch 1, so there is that too I guess.

I've played Overwatch 1 and some Overwatch 2 over on bnet - it's probably still a somewhat decent game but the almost predatory microtransactions are worse than the lootboxes in Overwatch 1; yes it's free 2 play, yes the devs need to earn money to keep the game going but please be more creative than a battlepass (that used to not give you back any premium currency for the first two seasons!), locking new heroes behind a paywall and underwhelming PvE missions that leave a sour taste in your mouth when you think about what it could have been.

But hey, Bobby needs a new yacht so more microtransactions are expected to pop up soon!

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.


ä¸æ˜¯äººä»¬æŠ›å¼ƒäº†å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ã€‚è€Œæ˜¯å®ˆæœ›å…ˆé”‹ä¸ä¼šæ˜¯ç©å®¶çš„è‹±é›„äº†ã€‚å†ä¹Ÿä¸ä¼šæ˜¯äº†ã€‚It's not that people abandoned Overwatch. It's that Overwatch won't be the player's hero anymore. Not Anymore.
Overwatch 2's descent into microtransaction madness has obliterated the once-fabulous gameplay. It's now just a money-grabbing circus. Avoid.

Overwatch might be the biggest ruined potential in the history of gaming.

What used to be a fun hero shooter turned into a mess of bad design and balancing decisions, full of bandaid fixes without adressing the actual issues with the game. And this is even before the mess that OW2 has been, falsely marketing a minor patch as a sequel to lure misguided players in.

Worst game adaptation so far, they did the rule34 dirty.
